title: Some online Maker-Breaker games
abstract:
We consider some Maker-Breaker games of the following flavor. We have some
set $V$ of items for purchase. Maker's goal is to purchase some member of a
given family $\cH$ of subsets of $V$ as cheaply as possible and Breaker's goal
is to make the purchase as expensive as possible. Each player has a pointer and
during a player's turn their pointer moves through the items in the order of
the permutation until the player decides to take one. We mostly focus on the
case where the permutation is random and unknown to the players (it is revealed
by the players as their pointers move).
